titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Cynthia Sanborn
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Cynthia Sanborn FA575

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-29 00:24:35 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Latin America and the Caribbean, Office Files of Cynthia Sanborn

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Cynthia Sanborn is a university professor, scholar on politics and development in Latin America, and former foundation program officer. For several years, she worked at the Ford Foundation. She started at the Foundation as an Assistant Program Officer in the Developing Country Programs. After a change in the Foundation's program structure, she became an Assistant Program Officer in the Latin America and the Caribbean Programs. She was later promoted to Program Officer and moved to the Latin America and the Caribbean Programs, Andean Region and the Southern Cone Program.

After she left the Ford Foundation, Sanborn became a professor at the Universidad del Pacifico in Peru. From 2009 to 2015, she was Director of the Research Center of the Universidad del Pacifico, and from 2015 to 2019, she served as Vice President for Research.

Sanborn earned a B.A. in political science from the University of Chicago, a master's degree in government from Harvard University, and a Ph.D. in government from Harvard University. Prior to joining the Ford Foundation, she had research positions at the University of California at Berkeley and Stanford University and was a Fulbright Scholar at the Pontificia Universidad Catolica del Peru.
